title: UHV Hardware Engineer NEW!
full_description: Microsoft Quantum Purdue seeks an engineer versed in ultra-high vacuum (UHV) technology to lead the design and deployment of next-generation UHV hardware necessary for the fabrication of topological qubits. Our work at Microsoft Quantum Purdue in West Lafayette, Indiana is part of global Microsoft Quantum effort in topological quantum computing. Work will take place at the Birck Nanotechnology Center, a 10 year old state of the art research facility with a 25,000 square foot clean room.This position is an opportunity to make impactful contributions to emerging quantum hardware technologies. Experience with design and maintenance of hardware for UHV systems such as molecular beam epitaxy (MBE) is required. In-depth knowledge of ultra-high vacuum design principles including choice of UHV compatible materials and manufacturing methods is also required. Expertise in crystal growth techniques will be considered favorably.  Employment Type: Full-Time
